intro: Acrosorus friderici-et-pauli, commonly known as the Friderici-et-Pauli's acrosorus, is a rare and enigmatic fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced in small, clustered sori on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
